Detailed Description

This file contains header file of the Doubly Linked List.

Version:
0.1

Define Documentation

#define DLListNULLIterator   INITPTR

Initial value for iterator.

Typedef Documentation

typedef int(* ptr2compare)(const void *, const void *)

Pointer to functon which is used as a comparision method in find function.

Parameters:
first is data from the list
second value provided by the user.
Returns:
0 when elements are equal, 1 when first is greater than second, -1 otherwise.

typedef void(* ptr2itunary)(DLListIterator)

Pointer to the unary function used in foreach list functionality.

Parameters:
first is theiterator pointing to the element of the list

typedef void(* ptr2unary)(void *)

Pointer to the unary function used in foreach list functionality.

Parameters:
first is the data from the list passed automatically during execution.

Function Documentation

int dl_list_add ( DLList *  list_handle,
void *  data 
)

Adds a new element to the end of the list.

Parameters:
list_handle link to list to which a new element is added.
data pointer to data that is stored on the list.
Returns:
0 in case of success, returns -1 and sets errno in case of failure.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL list handler is invalid
  • ENOMEM not enough memory to allocate new element of the list.

int dl_list_add_at ( DLList *  list_handle,
void *  data,
unsigned int  pos 
)

Adds a new element, at the given position, to the list.

Parameters:
list_handle link to list to which a new element is added.
data pointer to data that is stored on the list.
pos position on which the element will be added. [0;N-1]
Returns:
0 in case of success, returns -1 and sets errno in case of failure.
If pos is greater then actual size of the list then the element is added at the end of the list.

Possible errors:

  • EINVAL list handler is invalid
  • ENOMEM not enough memory to allocate new element of the list.

int dl_list_alter_it ( DLListIterator  it,
const void *  data 
)

Alters one element on the list.

Parameters:
it iterator which points to the element to be altered.
data new data which is going to be passed on the list.
Returns:
0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL input iterator

DLListIterator dl_list_at ( const DLList *  list_handle,
unsigned int  i 
)

Gets iterator pointing to the element at given position.

Parameters:
list_handle link to list.
i position of element in the list ( where i = [0,N] )
Returns:
iterator pointing to the element at i-th position. In case of failure NULL iterator is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL list handler is invalid
  • EFAULT i param is out of its range

unsigned dl_list_count ( DLListConstIterator  begin,
DLListConstIterator  end,
ptr2compare  unary,
const void *  data 
)

Counts elements on the list which are find by specified method that is used to compare.

Parameters:
begin left border of the search area
end right border of the search area
unary the function to call for each element.
data pointer to user data passed to the function.
Returns:
number of found items.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL when one or more parameters are invalid.

DLList* dl_list_create (  ) 

Creates a new doubly linked list.

Returns:
pointer to created list, or NULL along with setting the global errno variable.
Possible errors:
  • ENOMEM not enough memory to create list.

void* dl_list_data ( DLListConstIterator  it  ) 

Gets user data from iterator.

Parameters:
it iterator pointing to one of the elements of list.
Returns:
pointer to the user-data, in case of failure NULL is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL input iterator is invalid

DLListIterator dl_list_find ( DLListConstIterator  begin,
DLListConstIterator  end,
ptr2compare  unary,
const void *  data 
)

Finds element on the list using a supplied function as a method of comparison. Given function is called for each element in the list, in the given range. Function should return 0 when the element is found.

Parameters:
begin left border of the search area
end right border of the search area
unary the function to call for each element.
data pointer to user data passed to the function.
Returns:
iterator pointing to found element, or NULL iterator when nothing is found. In case of failure NULL iterator is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL when one or more parameters are invalid.

int dl_list_foreach ( DLListConstIterator  begin,
DLListConstIterator  end,
ptr2unary  unary 
)

Executes unary function for each data stored on the list.

Parameters:
begin [in] left delimiter.
end [in] right delimiter.
unary [in] adress of the unary function.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL when one or more parameters are invalid.

int dl_list_foreach_it ( DLListConstIterator  begin,
DLListConstIterator  end,
ptr2itunary  unary 
)

Executes unary function for each iterator on the list.

Parameters:
begin [in] left delimiter.
end [in] right delimiter.
unary [in] adress of the unary function.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL when one or more parameters are invalid.

void dl_list_free ( DLList **  list_handle  ) 

Frees memory allocated for doubly linked list. NOTE: Does not free memory allocated for data stored on the list!

Parameters:
list_handle adress of the pointer to the doubly linked list.

void dl_list_free_data ( DLList **  list_handle  ) 

Frees the data from each item in the list

Parameters:
list_handle adress of the pointer to the doubly linked list.

DLListIterator dl_list_head ( const DLList *  list_handle  ) 

Gives pointer to the first element of the list. NOTE: When handler to list is invalid errno is set to EINVAL

Parameters:
list_handle link to list from which element is returned.
Returns:
iterator pointing at the first element on the list. If list is empty NULL iterator is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL list handler is invalid

DLListIterator dl_list_next ( DLListConstIterator  it  ) 

Moves iterator in forward direction.

Parameters:
it iterator of some list
Returns:
iterator to the next element on the list. In case of failure, or when the end of list is reached NULL is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL input iterator is invalid

DLListIterator dl_list_prev ( DLListConstIterator  it  ) 

Moves iterator in backward direction.

Parameters:
it iterator of some list
Returns:
iterator to the previous element on the list. In case of failure, or when the begining of list is reached NULL is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL input iterator is invalid

int dl_list_remove_it ( DLListIterator  it  ) 

Removes element from the list which is specified by iterator pointer. NOTE: after removal allocated element is freed, and input iterator is set to NULL iterator;

Parameters:
it iterator pointing at the element which is going to be removed
Returns:
0 in case of success, returns -1 and sets errno in case of failure.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL input iterator is invalid

int dl_list_size ( const DLList *  list_handle  ) 

Tells how many elements are appended to the list.

Parameters:
list_handle link to list which size is returned.
Returns:
number of elements appended to the list, returns -1 and sets errno in case of failure.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL list handler is invalid

DLListIterator dl_list_tail ( const DLList *  list_handle  ) 

Gives pointer to the last element of the list. NOTE: When handler to list is invalid errno is set to EINVAL

Parameters:
list_handle link to list from which element is returned.
Returns:
iterator pointing at the last element on the list. If list is empty NULL iterator is returned.
Possible errors:
  • EINVAL list handler is invalid
